title: Kid wants $1500 Allowance, to Buy Gucci Shoes....

I mean there’s so much trash in some of the hallways.

As someone who’s disabled and can’t work, at 8:48 Pewds is totally right, having worked in the past and now not being able to I feel awful that I have to rely on family to live. I miss it. Everyday.

a man of his word he gotta be.

Perfect example of 'good intentions pave the way to hell' - I'm sure initially it seemed like a really nice idea to spoil her kid and give him the life I presume she didn't have growing up, but in the end it's just backfired and produced a human being who isn't equipped to deal with the real world and is making her life difficult on a daily basis.
If he wanted to be a youtuber, he could have spent that 1000 dollars to get the right equipment for it

In a lot of ways, an allowance helps a kid learn the value of money. I had $2 per week as a kid. If I wanted more, I had to work. At one point, as a teenager, I wanted a new computer so I could play games. I worked up (I earned half my age per week at this point), all the way to $1000 just so I could buy it. To hear that this kid gets that amount a month is insane. It took me my entire summer break working nearly non-stop to earn what to him is pocket change. When that's the way you see money, nothing has value to you anymore. When nothing has value to you anymore, you become a self indulgent narcissist, because in your mind you are worth more than everything else, because you can afford everything else. That's the power of respecting money. You earn it, you spend it wiser.

This kid's mother bought him a lot of luxury materials. Now, he associates love with her buying him whatever he wants. Because of that, the one time she said no, was when he felt genuinely hurt. His mother can fix her stupid mistake not by taking away the expensive items he has. Rather, she's supposed to start making time for her son. Gradually acclimating him so  that he feels the same security with inexpensive things, as he did with the others. If she does it right, he'll be able to make the decision to abandon the luxury objects.

I’m a Swede and I can explain how it works, basically the parents get the 120$ and they buy clothes for you and food and stuff but also some of the money goes to the allowance and when you get old enough, about 15 or 16, and usually the kid gets the hole 120 but then they have to pay their clothes. If any other Swede sees this and I was wrong in some way please correct me.
Little Felix’s memory of his parents first beating. “you know we can’t hit you in Sweden right Felix?” As he hears that the car passes a sign saying welcome to Sweden.
I remember having 5 dollars in my pocket as a kid was the best thing that could ever happen to me.
I'm cleaning my room while listening to this video and when he said "I do earn it, by cleaning my room" my little soul living paycheck to paycheck began to hurt
